data.title: mishti – Trisha's Kitchen Alchemy
data.meta_description: Posts about mishti written by sapphiredaze1986
data.text:
Malpua or Malpoa (in Bengali) is a popular Indian dessert, akin to a pancake, dipped in syrup. It is made around the country in different ways, especially during special occasions. The batter is usually made from flour, and flavoured with cardamom or fennel, deep-fried and then soaked in syrup. My Didu (maternal grandmother), was the…

While I lived in Mumbai, the need to make Bengali sweets never quite entered my mind; one, because I wasn’t cooking that much back then, and two, because apart from the North Indian and Maharashtrian varieties of mithais, we also had Bengali sweet shops to fulfill our craving. And then there were the summer vacations…
